definition: to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
to beat one's chest and stamp one's feet (idiom)

sentences.english: Mark beat his breast in agony .
sentences.chinese: 马克捶胸顿足，痛不欲生。

sentences.english: The price includes bed and Continental breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 这价格包括三顿足实的饭餐。

sentences.english: He was so angry, he began to jump and down.
The speaker gesticulated by raising his arms, pounding the desk, and stamping his foot.
sentences.chinese: 演说者举臂，捶桌，顿足以表达他的意思。

sentences.english: Four xi see nine sister turned and ran, cant help beat.
sentences.chinese: 四喜见九妹转头就跑，不禁捶胸顿足。

definition: scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
glare/angry look/to open one's eyes wide/to stare angrily/to glare/to glower
to beat one's chest and stamp one's feet (idiom)
to face upwards/to look up to the sky
lit. to slap the table (in amazement, praise, anger, resentment etc)/fig. astonishing!, wonderful!, dreadful! etc
